etymologies: late 19th century: from mono-‘single’ + Greek morphē ‘form’

definitions: having or existing in only one form.
shortDefinitions: having or existing in only one form

definitions: (of a species or population) showing little or no variation in morphology or phenotype.
shortDefinitions: (of species or population) showing little or no variation in morphology or phenotype

definitions: (of an animal species) having sexes that are similar in size and appearance.
shortDefinitions: (of animal species) having sexes that are similar in size and appearance
